summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and a contractor regarding a discovery review project for a case involving Tartaglione and Epstein. The emails discuss redactions, document production, and specific concerns about withholding information related to Tartaglione's conditions of confinement and an incident involving Epstein.

persons.name: Lonergan
persons.context: Sent the initial instructions for the discovery review project, specifying the scope to identify pages related to Tartaglione's conditions of confinement and emails regarding Touhy.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Subject of the discovery review; emails discuss redacting information solely about his conditions of confinement and an incident where he was questioned about an attack on Epstein.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to an incident where Tartaglione was questioned about an attack on him, and where Epstein informed a psychologist about Tartaglione discussing potentially injuring him.

connections.description: Both were incarcerated at MCC; document references an incident where Tartaglione was questioned about an attack on Epstein and where Epstein reported Tartaglione discussed potentially injuring him.
Lonergan, as an AUSA, is overseeing discovery review related to Tartaglione's case, specifically concerning conditions of confinement.

events.title: Discovery Production Finalization
events.description: Final cover letters for discovery production to defense counsel (Noel and Thomas) are prepared and ready for distribution via USAfx.

events.title: Review of Email Files Regarding Tartaglione/Epstein Incident
events.description: Contractor reviews email files, flagging uncertain portions about an email chain from Tartaglione's counsel regarding a leak/retaliation at MCC about a news story of Tartaglione questioned about an attack on Epstein, and where Epstein informs a psychologist about Tartaglione discussing potentially injuring him.

events.title: Discovery Review Project Initiation
events.description: AUSA Lonergan instructs a contractor to review email files to identify pages related solely to Tartaglione's conditions of confinement or emails regarding Touhy, for redaction purposes.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The document reveals an ongoing discovery review process in October 2020 related to a case involving Tartaglione, with specific instructions to redact information solely about his conditions of confinement.
It references a specific incident at MCC where Tartaglione was questioned about an attack on Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a connection between their incarcerations.
The emails show Epstein reported to a psychologist that Tartaglione discussed potentially injuring him, but no guards' report was filed about this discussion.
The production was intended for defense counsel named Noel and Thomas, indicating active litigation.
The review process involved careful scrutiny to separate issues related to Tartaglione from those involving Epstein, highlighting the complexity of the case.
